Have you recently applied for a mortgage and been bombarded by calls and texts from lenders?  Let’s talk about trigger leads.

When you apply for a mortgage, credit bureaus are notified that you are interested in financing, which is referred to as a trigger lead. That information is then sold by the credit bureaus to data brokers (including other lenders) without your knowledge or approval. That’s when other companies start working the phones to try to lure you away from your preferred lender. And you are left with dozens of calls and texts every day for weeks.

Trigger leads are a nuisance and an invasion of data privacy. Congress can do something about it. That’s why I am cosponsoring @RepJohnRose's legislation, the Homebuyers Privacy Protection Act to prohibit trigger leads unless you opt-in.
